qas.question: What's the point of ironing clothing?
What type of clothing is believed to look neat, fresh and clean?
Permanent press materials have been treated with what?
Many what are designed to be ironed?
What type of closing encourages wrinkles?

plausible_answers.text: treated with a coating (such as polytetrafluoroethylene)

qas.question: Doing what creates a rough appearance without ironing?

context: Many kinds of <b5_0>clothing<b5_0/> are designed to be ironed before they are worn <a0_0>to remove wrinkles<a0_0/>. Most modern formal and semi-formal clothing is in this category (for example, dress shirts and suits). <a1_0>Ironed<a1_0/> clothes are believed to look clean, fresh, and neat. Much contemporary casual clothing is made of <a2_0><b6_0>knit<b6_0/><a2_0/> materials that do not readily wrinkle, and do not require ironing. Some clothing is <b7_0>permanent press,<b7_0/> having been <b9_0>treated with <a3_0>a coating<a3_0/> (such as <b8_0>polytetrafluoroethylene<b8_0/>)<b9_0/> that suppresses <a4_0>wrinkles<a4_0/> and creates a smooth appearance without ironing.
